alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Sublette (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:29AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Green River near La Barge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding of low lying agricultural land next to gage. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Nearby homes begin to see high water. Fields south of town around the gaging station have ponded water (less than 1 foot deep). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Sunday, June 11, the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to slowly drop to 8.0 feet around mid-day Monday. It will then drop below action stage. Precipitation early this week may add to the river flows and keep it from going below action stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
